titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Fr. Nicholas Kostetsky Photographs and Ephemera g.9
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Michael Andrec

publicationstmt.publisher: Ukrainian Historical and Educational Center Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-01-10T18:08-0500

did.unittitle: Fr. Nicholas Kostetsky photographs and ephemera

repository.corpname: Ukrainian Historical and Educational Center Archives

did.abstract: Material collected by Fr. Nicholas Kostetsky relating to his experiences in the Ukrainian National Chorus in the 1920s, which inspired the American Christmas mega-hit "The Carol of the Bells".

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Nicholas Kostetsky was a member of the Ukrainian National Chorus (originally, the Ukrainian Republican Capella) who toured with the chorus in Europe and the US. He left the chorus and settled in western Pennsylvania. He served as garden cartaker at the Phillps Mansion in Butler, PA for many years, and at some point was ordained to the clergy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Fr. Nicholas Kostetsky Photographs and Ephemera; box number; folder number; Ukrainian Historical and Educational Center Archives, Somerset, New Jersey.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Nicholas Kostetsky to Gretchen Moore to Lovie Tymkiw.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of photographs, and ephemera related to the Ukrainian National Chorus (formerly, the Ukrainian Republic Capella). Contains photographs from Ukraine and Western Europe, as well as concert program from Buenos Aires, Argentina.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for researcher use. Please contact the archivist (archives@ukrhec.org) for more information and to make arrangements.
